channel.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
channel.description: Hey I was wondering what games on the marketplace that take a LONG TIME to beat the game. Like maybe a game like skyrim I was thinking, but people told me it wasn't worth it. Whats a game thats like runescape and has a long campaign is basically what i'm asking.

item.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

runescape

Read full topic

item.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Deus Ex: The Conspiracy (the best P.C. game ever made without a doubt)

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (not the M.M.O.R.P.G.)

Diablo 2

Divine Divinity

Arcanum: Of Steamworks and Magick Obscura

Gothic 2

Half-Life 2

The Elder Scrolls 2: Daggerfall

The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion

Arx Fatalis

Hitman: Blood Money

Sim City 4

Splinter Cell 3

Fallout 2

Fallout: New Vegas

Swat 4

etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Games that take awhile to beat!

item.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:18, topic:523107”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=641659.msg4326322#msg4326322 date=1372978633]
Did you get Skyrim?
[/quote]
hell yeah mate, already a level 16 imperial, althought I changed my mind at level 4 and started doing range/onehanded stuff. I have 52 range and 31 one hand, and 12k coins, right now i’m trying to beat mercer frey in the theives guild quest. Thanks heaps for the recommendation mate[/quote]

No problem, glad you’re enjoying it!

Read full topic
item.source: Games that take awhile to beat!

item.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
item.dc:creator: @ArmorCroc ArmorCroc
item.description:
@ArmorCroc wrote:

Dragon Age: Origins - Great game, would sure replay 'cause there are so many possibilities.
The Elder Scrolls: III Morrowind - Personally my favorite game.
The Elder Scrolls: IV Oblivion - Gives some more story to Morrowind and the “Shivering Isles” add-on is pure gold!
The Elder Scrolls: V Skyrim - Liquid cheesecake! And the last DLC, “Dragonborn”, even more of the liquid cheesecake!
Divinity II: Dragon Knight Saga - Strange and special, good one anyway!
Dungeon Siege II/III - At least the second one (DS II) is really long and addictive.

A game shorter than it’s name:
Crysis 3 - The exact moment I felt this game started, I was reading the end credits. And they are the longest part of the game ~30 minutes!

Ummm… I wrote this and remembered you’re using a console… I’ll post it anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Games that take awhile to beat!

stronghold games, it depends on how fast you are though. if you are rushing or like playing long, but i would say some games can take up to 4 hours. Any strategy game takes a while to be honest, warcraft took a while but was good story

item.source: Games that take awhile to beat!

item.title: Games that take awhile to beat!
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:7, topic:523107”][quote author=KroniKz_ link=topic=641659.msg4322322#msg4322322 date=1372367962]

skyrim

People were saying that exploring instead of doing the quests was a lot of fun. What does that mean, what do you do?

It’s entirely open-world so you can just wander around and find loads of huts, houses, villages, etc, that are hidden from the maps. The Elder Scrolls universe is massive, there are physical books that you can read.

and whats so fun about “wandering” do you kill stuff and find cool things to do?
is it basically the same concept as GTA IV and just go around killing people because its fun?
[/quote]

You can find dungeons, side-quests, items, loads. It’s very different to GTA.[/quote]
ok then I’m gonna go drive to gamestop now, should I pick up AC III? is that one worth playing as well?

Read full topic
item.source: Games that take awhile to beat!

People were saying that exploring instead of doing the quests was a lot of fun. What does that mean, what do you do?

It’s entirely open-world so you can just wander around and find loads of huts, houses, villages, etc, that are hidden from the maps. The Elder Scrolls universe is massive, there are physical books that you can read.
[/quote]
and whats so fun about “wandering” do you kill stuff and find cool things to do?
is it basically the same concept as GTA IV and just go around killing people because its fun?[/quote]

You can find dungeons, side-quests, items, loads. It’s very different to GTA.
